description: Execute timesteps. The synonym 'model step' may also be used. This is the equivalent of calling 'model solve' with the cycles keyword set to i. i timesteps are executed unless processing is interrupted by pressing Shift + Esc, which will terminate cycling, exit the current data file (and all levels of nested data files that may have been used to call it), and return input to the command prompt after the current step is completed. The optional calm keyword is used in mechanical processes to reset the linear and angular velocities to zero every i2 cycles.

keywords.name: calm
keywords.description: Reset linear and angular velocities to zero every i2 cycles during mechanical processes

notes: Synonym: 'model step' can be used instead of 'model cycle'
Interruption: Press Shift + Esc to terminate cycling after current step completes
Interruption exits current data file and all nested data files, returns to command prompt
calm keyword: periodically removes kinetic energy during cycling
calm is useful for quasi-static simulations to prevent dynamic effects
Each cycle advances simulation by one timestep (dt)
Timestep can be automatic (model timestep auto) or fixed (model timestep fix)

examples.description: Execute 10000 timesteps, reset all velocities to zero every 100 cycles
Quasi-static simulation: cycle with frequent velocity damping

examples.command:
model solve
model cycle 1000
model solve
examples.description: Solve to equilibrium, run fixed cycles, solve again

examples.command:
ball generate number 1000 radius 0.5
model clean
model cycle 2000
examples.description: Generate balls, clean to create contacts, then cycle

python_sdk_alternative.notes: Python SDK provides itasca.cycle(n) function. calm keyword not available in Python - use periodic itasca.command('model calm') in loop if needed
